intro: Eriospermum cooperi var. cooperi, commonly known as the Cooper's eriospermum, is a rare and delicate perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species.
